Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at that.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I love cycling. Andy, I feel like a tourist in my own city. I literally can't wait to wake up every morning.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She is a beaut!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can't beat a horse. A horse is a bike that peddles itself.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes, it is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, look at that. [pushing bike] Smooth roll.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You got it! Lance Armstrong's Bike!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: His ass was on that seat? All right!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, Meredith, that's not his actual bicycle, but it is the same exact model he uses.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm on Sheryl Crow's side in that whole thing, so I feel really weird right now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [crashing sound] Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, god!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I can ride a bike. I take spinning classes three times a month. I think I know how to ride a bike.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you sure you once knew how to do this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did, yes! I had those extra wheels on the back...that support you. [Pam and Jim begin wheeling him] Mi-chael! Mi-chael!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [chanting] Mi-chael! Mi-chael! Mi-chael! Mi-chael!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on, Michael! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just steer more now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [crashes into Jim and Pam's parked car] Oh, my god!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not the car!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No! No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ow! [grunts, stumbles to his feet] You never forget. Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How do I look?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Amazing. How do I look?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Normal. Ugly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I do the best with what I've got. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alright. Wait, wait, wait, wait for me! It's weird if I come in slightly after.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We have a big meeting with the chief buyer for Frames Select, Steve Nash.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's not the Steve Nash. He's big though. He's kind of like...Scranton's Steve Nash.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Will you stop trying to put it in terms you think they'll understand? It's condescending.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not doing that. I'm just explaining.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And who is this "the" Steve Nash?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Phoenix Sun's point guard?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No? Nothin'?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Mr. Jock Hipster.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I'm neither of those things, so...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [reading Cornell magazine] Whoa. Libby Dirketts got married. Big Red mazel tov to the Libster. Ooh, says here Dan Becker fell off the side of Kilimanjaro in a climbing accident. It appears Dan's Sherpa survived to tell the tale-Oh, my God!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What? Is Dan okay?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, he died. It's Broccoli Rob. You know this guy; I showed you his picture on Facebook.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: "Some Vermont-based alums can hear 'Broccoli' Rob Blatt, '96, in the state milk lobby's new milk awareness song, 'Calci-YUM!', featuring Phish's Trey Anastasio. Says Broccoli, 'Trey and I had a ton of fun in the studio, and I think you can hear it in the song.'"

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, that's great news for your friend.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, it's great...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You know, I forget about milk. This is a terrific reminder.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was the artsy, musical one. In Here Comes Treble I had four solos, Broccoli rob had three. Right? Uhh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go tell her we're here. You're good with receptionists.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, ha ha ha. Dwight...[motions to lobby]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Crap.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Danny Cordray is the worst.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, by worst, you mean the best.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The best salesman ever. He works for Osprey Paper over in Throop, steals more clients from Dunder-Mifflin than anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, the situation is the worst.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Also, he slept with Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, he didn't. [Dwight mouthing "yes, he did"]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Tell 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nothing happened. We went on a couple of dates. He never called me again.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? He never called you? I thought you said it just fizzled.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's fizzling. I mean, someone has to start the fizzle.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I thought you started it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I liked him. For a couple of days. Four years ago. [Jim nodding repeatedly] You know I have a kid with you, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ahhh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna intimidate him. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, great-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Watch this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: -I'm just gonna watch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [speaking loudly] So anyway, she says, "that is the biggest penis I have ever seen." And I said, "I know. That's why I brought you to the Penis Museum, where tickets are a thousand dollars." Well, hello Danny!

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. Good to see you. Jim, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [shaking hands] How are ya?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Good to see you too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm just here for the coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Like hell you are.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's not just here for the coffee, Jim. Wake up!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Brainstorming session is now open. Anyone has an idea-[cell phone rings] Hold on. Sorry, sorry, sorry. Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, it's Jim. Listen, this is important. Are you busy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey. No, I'm not busy. What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You are busy! We're in a meeting!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's Jim, Okay? Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Listen, you gotta get over here, 'cause we're pitching Steve Nash and Danny Cordray is here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You need the big guns, yes?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What'd he say? What did he say?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The big gun thing. [Dwight grabs at phone] Stop!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will see you in ten. Bye! Hold tight. [hangs up] Well, I know a lot of you thought that my sales days were behind me, and to be honest, so did I...and the only reason I got out of the sales game was to be reluctantly called back in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You don't look reluctant, Michael. You look really eager.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] No, I don't have time for this. Are you kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You don't?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! Okay. [runs out the door] All right.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [knocking] Knockity-knock, don't knock back. Just kidding you can knock; it's your office. Do you have a minute?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm very busy with time-sensitive work.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not to go all Sherlock Holmes on you, but I can tell by the reflection in your glasses that you're entering points into Weight Watchers dot com.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: If you don't enter them immediately, you forget. What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm starting a band and I need you on keyboards.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Nah. I play for pleasure.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is for pleasure.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I wouldn't enjoy that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm willing to pay you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: How much?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sixty bucks a session.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's crazy money. I'll take forty.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There he is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, that's a male model.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, that's him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That...hello. Michael Scott, Dunder-Mifflin Paper Company.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Danny Cordray, Osprey Paper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Three of you guys for one sale.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well...we call it overkill. Why am I telling you my strategy?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Well, whatever works for ya. Anyway. All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: It's good to see you guys. Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Buh-bye. I could swear that guy was a male model.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: He's ready for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you. All right. On the count of three, it's showtime. Ready, one, two-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope, not doing that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've been in showtime mode since breakfast.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, you know-all right, just forget it then.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Showtime!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's showtime! Oh...never mind. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I knock on your door, you know who it is; it's Michael Scott. We've been together forever and we-

Quote.Speaker: Steve
Quote.Text: Michael, I appreciate everything that Dunder-Mifflin has done for this company.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? You are having some problems with your loading dock, are you not? All right. We're going to deliver to you on weekends.

Quote.Speaker: Steve
Quote.Text: That's very generous, but-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And you know what else we're gonna do? I can't believe I'm gonna say this...we are going to offer you our paper at cost. I know. I could get in a lotta trouble for this, so you'd better shake my hand right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's not kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shake it, shake it!

Quote.Speaker: Steve
Quote.Text: Michael, I'm going with Danny.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Steve
Quote.Text: Thanks for coming in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Steve
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks, Steve.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim talked too much.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, you did.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop it. Just stop it. We did what we should have done, we just got bested. [pounds the elevator button] Why is there a door close button if it doesn't even close the door?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do I feel about losing the sale? It's like if Michael Phelps came out of retirement, jumped in the pool, belly-flopped, and drowned.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know who we always lose out to? Staples, the big guys. Osprey? They're a small company. They're smaller than we are. What's our excuse? How do we combat this guy? Stanley, how do we combat him?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We sell better?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. You know what? You clearly don't care, so why don't you just leave?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I would like to stay. This pertains to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you go outside and...take a shot of insulin and have a nap, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why do you always assume I have diabetes?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, your frame, your build-why don't you have a glass of apple juice and tell me you're not a diabetic. [Stanley stands to leave] See? I could tell by the sound you made when you stood up that you have-okay. Yes, Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I could try to seduce him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my god!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know how we can learn his tricks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What I am about to show you is of the utmost secrecy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that your office?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, Jim. And with a little tweaking, it becomes a different office. We lure Danny to it and watch him sell.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm outta here.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: This is weird.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what this is? This is a stinger.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like the movie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you mean The Sting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Paul Newman, Robert Redford. They're bank robbers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. Different movie.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Sting. The Sting.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Your two o'clock. [Danny enters]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thanks, hun.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Meredith was the perfect choice to play the head of the company. Her lunch break lined up with our appointment with Danny and...that's it. That's really all we were looking for.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Danny Cordray. It's great to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Meredith Van Helsing. Pleased to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Meredith Van Helsing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Van Helsing was a respected professor before he was a vampire killer.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. But what is he more famous for?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shhh! Hey! That's my mug.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know this isn't real TV, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl and Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] Please Mr. President, if you wanna give hope a whirl, bring our troops home safe and sound, says this little girl.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in falsetto] Please Mr. President-

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: One second, one second, one second. [stops playing] So, this song is from the point of view of a little girl?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: But you're singing it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I'm using my falsetto.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, that's not a good idea. I don't see that as a very good song.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, it'd sound a lot better if you actually sang with some soul.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, I never sing with soul.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's a lie.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I could sing it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just was hoping to maybe save your voice in case we did a novelty song about frogs.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But my voice is unique. Like Bob Dylan.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, three-way argument between a drummer, a keyboardist, and the front man lead singer. Wonder who's gonna win this one. Two, three, four-

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: I'm gonna take off my coat, if you don't mind. It's a bit warm in here.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hel-lo!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no. No. Don't-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: People can't keep their true natures hidden for long, and this guy is smoldering like a tire fire.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Testify.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, he's not that good-looking. I don't understand why everybody's obsessed with this-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, he is that good-looking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's very, very handsome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: That's a great set of shoulder's you got there. What is that...Genetics? Creatine? [phone rings] Sorry. Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pull it together, all right? Stop lookin' at him.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. [hangs up] You're here to sell me some paper.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Well, actually, uh... no, Miss Van Helsing, that's not why I'm here. I'm here to meet you, see if we'd be a, you know, good fit.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh...my god! He's making her sell to him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [everyone finishes listening to song] Okay. Honest feedback time. Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's pandering. And it makes me think you think I'm stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But do you think it could be famous? Like in a car commercial or something?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not really. It's kinda weird that a grown man is singing from the point of view of a little girl.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I feel like I can see someone ice skating to it. You know, like in the Olympics.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I-I don't think they usually...skate to such...bad songs.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Rude. And not helpful.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Well, I really, really, really liked it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, that...really bums me out.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: We should think of this as a first date. And I think it's going very well, how 'bout you?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Real well. Uh...feels more like a third date to me.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Ha ha, okay, there you go! [phone rings, Meredith answers]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stay-

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Shut up and let me do this! [hangs up] You know, what is with this desk keeping us so far apart?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: I've never been a desk man. Always traveling on the road. Come on...why not, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Well, we'll get this...[Meredith unbuttons]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, man!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: So, what's your drink? You a vodka man? Me too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We gotta get someone else in there right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're an exec at Pennsylvania Solartech and-

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That sounds fake.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I told you! You're an exec at Stark Industries, a corporation you inherited from your father-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Will you stop? Stop it, stop it. Here's the story-they need Meredith somewhere else asap, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So you're taking over. You just gotta get her out of there as soon as you can.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: All right. I can do that. Then what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then make him pitch to you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We gotta see what he's got.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Exactly. You can do this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, and remember-you're not gay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop it! It's gonna be great.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And listen if anything else happens, just...roll with it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Meredith, I-

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh, Manuel! This is Manuel, my cleaning man. He doesn't speak any English.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Hola. Que tal?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Como estas, senor?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Uh, Manuel, cleano el window.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who else we got?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. You're a young hotshot from Stark Industries. You've just bought this company. Meredith is fired. It's a whole new regime. He's gotta pitch to you now.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay. Stark Industries isn't real. I run Google. Larry and Sergey brought me in-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great. Sounds awesome. Just have him pitch to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't let us down.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [points to Jim] Will do. [points to Michael] Won't do.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Yeah, sure.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You smell like a Scorpio. [Ryan enters] This is...Esteban...another cleaning man. He doesn't speak English either. Esteban, el flooro.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: You know what? I may have parked my car in a compact space, and I hate when I see others do that, so-

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Danny, I feel a real connection to you, and I gotta get real, I'm-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no....

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm goin 'in!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael! No, Michael, stop it! No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop, stop! Oh, my god! [enters office] Okay. Stop it, stop it, stop it. Gross! Stop it, please. Everybody, stop.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I said stop. Okay, Danny...this is not Pennsylvania Solartech. This is Dunder-Mifflin Paper Company. This is Meredith Palmer-

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Please to meet you-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't! Get away from him. Please, just leave. Get out of here. Go. Forever.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I owe you...a most sincere and humble apology. We were trying to watch you to see your sales technique, so we could stop losing so many clients to you.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: But from where?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A surveillance room next to this one.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Okay, so you...set up this fake company, then you hired this homeless woman to impersonate an executive to spy on me so that you could copy my sales technique?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. And it's the sincerest form of flattery.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Or...crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well-

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: I'm gonna go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. You know what, it wasn't just me. Jim and Dwight are behind that wall in the surveillance room and it was their plan as well.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Oh, well then, yeah. All right. Hey! [knocking on wall] Good luck, guys. Seems like you got a great operation here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, we don't. Here's-here's my point. Danny, listen, you have to understand that we are not normally like this. We just-we wanted to know your tricks.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: What do you mean, my tricks? There's no tricks, man. I'm just a good salesman. You wanna copy that? You can't copy that! [opens door to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are, you are. You are! Stop it, stop it. Stop. [closes door] You are a good salesman. And because of that...I want you to work for me.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Sure. You seem like a fun, professional guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, you will?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: [opening door again to leave] No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hold it, hold it. [forcing door closed] Hold on, hold on. Wait, wait, wait, wait. Wait. Wait. Danny, I want you to look at me. Do you want your life to be better...or to be worse or to stay the same?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Get out of my way.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Answer the question. Do you want a better life, Danny?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: I swear to God, I'm gonna hit you. I didn't mean that. I'm sorry. I'm not-it's just I'm very upset right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: I'm very upset!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you want more freedom, less freedom, or to stay the same?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: More freedom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can give you more money-there's your better life. I can let you come and go as you please-there's your freedom. And you already know Dunder-Mifflin has the best service and the best prices, but you beat us anyway. Can you imagine how well you would do selling our stuff?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everyone, may I have your attention? I would like to introduce you to Mr. Danny Cordray. He is going to be joining us as our new traveling salesman. Say hello to Danny!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [bleep] me!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: O-kay. You know what? No. No. This is not some sort of construction site...or all of Italy, where you can just go around treating people like meat. We are to respect him. I respect him because he reminds me of somebody. Can anybody guess who that is?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Josh Duhamel.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, I can see that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. No. Somebody in this office.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: He's like a better-looking Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thanks, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, me. Right? Sorta like...a little younger version of me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's hard to judge ourselves accurately, isn't it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I talk to you about something?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you may not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's about this very announcement you just made.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I said no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're not-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, I think you really want to talk to him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Let's-all right, all right. Let's talk. Please don't let him leave. [pointing to Danny] Don't leave. Don't let him.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Gotcha. [they go into Michael's office]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You hired him?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guys, let me ask you something. Do you want your life to be better or worse or stay the same?

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Stay the same.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Well...get ready, 'cause it's gonna get better.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's not gonna get better; he's gonna steal all of our clients.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. Wrong. He would have stolen your clients, but you know what? He can't now. This guy used to steal sales from us; now, he's going to steal sales for us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where's he gonna sit? There's no more seats.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He doesn't need to sit, he's a traveling salesman. Look, I am not going to exclude good people from our staff simply because they are threatening to you. And unless you have a better argument than that, I suggest you leave.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hmpf!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where's he gonna park? There's no more reserved parking spots.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good-bye!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Song's about truth.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What's something you really care about?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Reverse snobbery.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: More universal.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sometimes I feel like life has passed me by.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [plays soft chords and sings] Couldn't get outta bed today. Wish the alarm clock would go away.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, nice!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Holy crap. Are you kidding me? You just made that-that's amazing!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] Which me am I gonna be today?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Which me am I gonna be today?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I gotta closet full of mes. Am I gonna be the happy me?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Or the me that stinks.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, my gosh! We're almost out of time. How much for another half hour?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, don't worry about it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wait. Seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So we're just, like, jamming as friends?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: One, two, three, hit it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Closet full of mes-

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Oh, you know...funny. Your wife and I went on a few dates.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did ya?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Yeah. Way ,way, way back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm just kidding. She told me about it.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Oh. She was not into me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Obviously. I don't even think she called me back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You snubbed her.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me handle this, Jim. Drop the act, Cordray, okay? We all know that you probably thought that Pam was too "meh" or thin without being toned. But I wanna tell you something-she is one of the plain hearty women of Scranton that make this city great. And so what if she doesn't wear makeup? [Pam mouthing "I wear makeup"] We like her better that way! And you steal clients, don't you? Don't you!

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Okay...that's different.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, that's different, is it? Okay...thief. You better check your things, people. In fact, where are my keys? Oh, there in my pocket. False alarm. Okay. [awkward pause] So...you're gonna be workin' here?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Uh...I mean-yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Welcome aboard.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, crazy, um...so...that's it? You're just-you're fine?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's after 5:00, Jim. I'm not gonna take this home. [shakes Danny's hand]

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pleasure.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This morning, Danny Cordray stole a sale from me. So what do I do? I go out and I steal Danny Cordray. The sale that mattered, I made. Boom. Funny thing about it, we don't even need him. We already have Packer on the road. Chhguuh! Crap. I forgot about Packer.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [singing and playing drums] Sun's in her eyes, tongue full of flies. Would you like to share my paaaaaaad?

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Croak, croak, croak. Bullfrog in love. Croak, croak, croak. Bullfrog in love and I gave her the croak that meant I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll be your croak monsieur.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [falsetto] I'll be your croak madame.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Your mama mighta said that bullfrogs are dogs, but I'm here to tell you that I am a frog! Come and sit on my log, you little pollywog.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I find you absolutely ribbiting!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Croak, croak, croak. Bullfrog in love.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Croak, croak, croak. Bullfrog in love.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Croak!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ribbit!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Scoopity-splash!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice.
